Dispute_Type: Visa denial based on medical inadmissibility
Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of visa denial due to medical inadmissibility of non-accompanying family member
Credibility_Assessment: Adoption by aunt assessed as not genuine
Evidence_Type: Medical records, custody arrangements, adoption documentation
Legal_Provision: IRPA s.42(a), Regulations s.23, Regulations s.4
Basis_of_Claim: Exclusion of disabled child from application, disputed adoption
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Applicability of s.23 exemption for custody arrangements
Regulation_Cited: IRPA s.42(a), IRPR s.23, IRPR s.4
Application_Error: Failure to consider s.23 exemption, inadequate analysis of adoption legality
Review_Outcome: Decision overturned and remitted for redetermination
Evidence_Ignored: Potential validity of custody arrangement under s.23
Legal_Standard: Interpretation and application of IRPA and Regulations
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether denial was reasonable under law
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA s.42(a): bars entry if family member inadmissible; IRPR s.23: exemption for valid custody; IRPR s.4: bad faith adoptions disallowed
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA s.42(a), IRPR s.23, IRPR s.4
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient factual support for adoption determination
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to properly assess applicable exemptions
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of Visa Officer’s interpretation and application of law
Relevant_Law: IRPA, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Procedural_Issue: Inadequate reasoning and failure to apply regulatory exemption
Omission_Type: Failure to consider applicability of s.23
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Health grounds – likely excessive demand on health services
